stereo.plots.plot_spatial_cluster¶

stereo.plots.plot_spatial_cluster(adata, cluster_names=['phenograph'], pos_key='spatial', plot_cluster=None, bad_color='lightgrey', ncols=2, dot_size=None, color_list=['violet', 'turquoise', 'tomato', 'teal', 'tan', 'silver', 'sienna', 'red', 'purple', 'plum', 'pink', 'orchid', 'orangered', 'orange', 'olive', 'navy', 'maroon', 'magenta', 'lime', 'lightgreen', 'lightblue', 'lavender', 'khaki', 'indigo', 'grey', 'green', 'gold', 'fuchsia', 'darkgreen', 'darkblue', 'cyan', 'crimson', 'coral', 'chocolate', 'chartreuse', 'brown', 'blue', 'black', 'beige', 'azure', 'aquamarine', 'aqua'])¶

showing spatial bin-cell distribution after clustering

Parameters

  • adata (AnnData) – the annotation data which contents cluster’s analysis results.

  • cluster_names (list) – the cluster task’s name, defined when running ‘Clustering’ tool by setting ‘name’ property.

  • pos_key (str) – the coordinates of data points for scatter plots. the data points are stored in adata.obsm[pos_key]. choice: “spatial”, “X_umap”, “X_pca”.

  • plot_cluster (Optional[list]) – the name list of clusters to show.

  • bad_color (str) – set nan values color.

  • ncols (int) – numbr of plot columns.

  • dot_size (Optional[int]) – marker size.

  • color_list – whether to invert y-axis.

Returns

None
